page.title: 16THE FARMER
page.content: The farmer with the larger farm was born into a large family having 8 brothers and 6 sisters many of whom still farm in the area.He has a son and daughter,but he does not care if the farm is carried on by them because he feels that the family farm is dying out. He lives in a brick cottage adjacent to the church and manor house with a magnificent view of his fields and surrounding countryside.He has kept his farm neat and tidy retaining the hedges and old barns. The farmer likes sport for recreation; his wife though prefers hunting. He makes use of a consultant from a firm that offers a Computer service.He believes that the future of the British arable farmer will depend on his ability to meet the current economic, political and environmental demands.
